title: How did suggestion heal a wound and challenge the supernatural?
first_phrase: The text explores the use of suggestion in producing physical symptoms in a subject's body. The experiment was conducted by M. Focachon on a woman, Z..., in a hypnotic state. The subject displayed a wound that would not heal until M. Focachon gave permission. The experiment was repeated, and the wound was made to produce blood on the experimenter's command. The results were very encouraging. The author suggests that the experiment be repeated with a religious twist to reproduce the stigmata phenomenon.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the results obtained by M. Focachon's experiments on suggestion-induced stigmata prove to be quite promising. For those who wish to replicate the experiments, it is recommended to use religious ideas to obtain more convincing results. Also, for accurate scientific examination, it is essential to have controlled results, and it is hoped that Mr. Focachon has provided such controls in his experiments, as verified by the medical experts of Nancy.
